html: Just as Jehovah enhances the blessing of his people’s lands by regenerating and adorning them (vv 11-12; Isaiah 35:1-2; 51:3), so he enhances the blessing of their posterity by personally teaching them. The basis of these blessings is his people’s righteousness—the opposite of their former wickedness that caused their oppression and ruin. The peace they long sought but couldn’t find thus comes as a covenant blessing not from human agreements. Jehovah’s servant—his righteousness (Isaiah 41:2; 46:11-13)—establishes their peace (Isaiah 9:6-7; 11:4-9; 16:5; 32:1, 16-20; 33:20; 52:7; 55:4-5, 12).
